title: AWS Cloud Fundamentals
description: This course provides a foundational understanding of Amazon Web Services (AWS), its core services, and the value it brings to businesses. Students will learn about cloud concepts, AWS services, security, architecture, pricing, and support.

modules.title: Introduction to Cloud Computing and AWS
modules.lesson: Learn the fundamentals of cloud computing and the history of AWS. Understand the benefits of cloud computing and the different cloud computing models.

modules.title: Core AWS Services
modules.lesson: Explore core AWS services such as EC2, S3, VPC, and IAM. Learn how to launch a virtual server, store data, and manage network security.

modules.title: AWS Security and Compliance
modules.lesson: Understand the AWS shared responsibility model and learn about key security services like IAM, KMS, and AWS Shield.

modules.title: AWS Pricing and Support
modules.lesson: Learn how AWS pricing works and how to use the AWS Free Tier. Explore the different AWS support plans available.

quiz.question: What does EC2 stand for?
Which service is used for object storage in AWS?
What is the AWS shared responsibility model?
options: AWS is responsible for all security.
The customer is responsible for all security.
AWS is responsible for security 'of' the cloud, and the customer is responsible for security 'in' the cloud.
Security is not a concern in the cloud.
quiz.answer: AWS is responsible for security 'of' the cloud, and the customer is responsible for security 'in' the cloud.

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified AWS Cloud Practitioner
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

title: Google Cloud Basics
description: This course introduces Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its core infrastructure and services. Participants will learn about computing, storage, databases, and networking in the Google Cloud.

modules.title: Introduction to Google Cloud
modules.lesson: Get an overview of Google Cloud Platform, its global infrastructure, and key differentiators.

modules.title: Core GCP Services
modules.lesson: Learn about Compute Engine, Cloud Storage, and Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) networks.

modules.title: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
modules.lesson: Understand how to manage users, roles, and permissions in GCP using Cloud IAM.

modules.title: GCP Pricing and Billing
modules.lesson: Learn about GCP's pricing philosophy, billing accounts, and how to estimate costs.

quiz.question: What is the equivalent of AWS EC2 in Google Cloud?
Which GCP service is used for object storage?
What does VPC stand for in the context of Google Cloud?

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified Google Cloud Associate
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

title: Microsoft Azure Essentials
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to Microsoft Azure. Students will learn about core Azure services, solutions, and management tools, preparing them for the AZ-900 exam.

modules.title: Introduction to Azure
modules.lesson: Discover the fundamentals of cloud computing and how Microsoft Azure fits into the picture. Learn about the benefits and economies of scale.

modules.title: Core Azure Services
modules.lesson: Explore Azure's core services, including Virtual Machines, Blob Storage, and Azure Virtual Networks.

modules.title: Azure Security, Privacy, and Trust
modules.lesson: Learn about Azure's security features, privacy policies, and how to manage compliance.

modules.title: Azure Pricing and Support
modules.lesson: Understand Azure's pricing models, subscriptions, and the support options available to customers.

quiz.question: What is the name of Azure's virtual machine service?
Which Azure service is used for storing large amounts of unstructured data?
What is the foundational service for networking in Azure?

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified Azure Fundamentals Practitioner
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

title: DevOps Foundations
description: This course provides a strong foundation in DevOps principles and practices. You will learn about the DevOps lifecycle, culture, and the key tools and technologies used in modern software development and operations.

modules.title: Introduction to DevOps
modules.lesson: Understand the core concepts of DevOps, its benefits, and how it improves collaboration between development and operations teams.

modules.title: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)
modules.lesson: Learn how to automate the build, test, and deployment process using CI/CD pipelines.

modules.title: Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
modules.lesson: Explore the practice of managing and provisioning infrastructure through code using tools like Terraform and Ansible.

modules.title: Monitoring and Logging
modules.lesson: Learn how to monitor application performance and troubleshoot issues using logging and monitoring tools.

modules.title: DevOps Culture and Best Practices
modules.lesson: Understand the cultural shift required for a successful DevOps transformation and learn about key best practices.

quiz.question: What are the three core pillars of DevOps?
What is the primary goal of CI/CD?
options: To manually deploy code to production.
To automate the software delivery process.
To reduce the number of bugs.
quiz.answer: To automate the software delivery process.

quiz.question: Which of the following is an example of an IaC tool?

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified DevOps Professional
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

title: Docker & Containerization
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to Docker and containerization. You will learn how to create, manage, and deploy applications using Docker containers.

modules.title: Introduction to Containers and Docker
modules.lesson: Understand the difference between containers and virtual machines and learn the basics of Docker.

modules.title: Docker Images and Containers
modules.lesson: Learn how to build Docker images and run Docker containers.

modules.title: Docker Networking and Storage
modules.lesson: Explore Docker networking concepts and learn how to manage data in Docker containers.

quiz.question: What is a Docker image?
options: A running instance of a container.
A lightweight, standalone, executable package of software that includes everything needed to run an application.
A file that describes the services, networks, and volumes for a Docker application.
A tool for managing and orchestrating containers.
quiz.answer: A lightweight, standalone, executable package of software that includes everything needed to run an application.

quiz.question: What is the command to build a Docker image?
What is a Dockerfile?
options: A file that contains a list of running containers.
A text document that contains all the commands a user could call on the command line to assemble an image.
A file that describes the services, networks, and volumes for a Docker application.
A file that contains the logs of a container.
quiz.answer: A text document that contains all the commands a user could call on the command line to assemble an image.

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified Docker Associate
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

title: Kubernetes for Beginners
description: This course introduces you to Kubernetes, the leading container orchestration platform. You will learn how to deploy, manage, and scale containerized applications using Kubernetes.

modules.title: Introduction to Kubernetes
modules.lesson: Understand the architecture of Kubernetes and its core concepts, such as Pods, Services, and Deployments.

modules.title: Kubernetes Objects
modules.lesson: Learn how to work with common Kubernetes objects, including Pods, ReplicaSets, and Deployments.

modules.title: Services, Load Balancing, and Networking
modules.lesson: Explore how to expose your applications to the outside world using Services and Ingress.

modules.title: Stateful Applications in Kubernetes
modules.lesson: Learn how to manage stateful applications in Kubernetes using Persistent Volumes and StatefulSets.

quiz.question: What is the basic scheduling unit in Kubernetes?
Which Kubernetes object is used to expose an application to the outside world?
What is the command-line tool for interacting with a Kubernetes cluster?

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified Kubernetes Administrator
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

title: Git & GitHub Mastery
description: This course will teach you the fundamentals of Git and GitHub. You will learn how to use Git for version control and how to collaborate with others on GitHub.

modules.title: Introduction to Version Control and Git
modules.lesson: Learn the basics of version control and how to install and configure Git.

modules.title: Basic Git Commands
modules.lesson: Learn the essential Git commands, such as git add, git commit, and git push.

modules.title: Branching and Merging
modules.lesson: Understand how to work with branches in Git and how to merge changes from one branch to another.

quiz.question: What is the command to initialize a new Git repository?
What is the command to stage changes for a commit?
What is the purpose of a .gitignore file?
options: To ignore all files in a repository.
To specify intentionally untracked files to ignore.
To list all the files in a repository.
To store the commit history of a repository.
quiz.answer: To specify intentionally untracked files to ignore.

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified Git & GitHub User
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

title: Linux Command Line
description: This course will teach you the fundamentals of the Linux command line. You will learn how to navigate the file system, manage files and permissions, and use essential command-line tools.

modules.title: Introduction to the Linux Command Line
modules.lesson: Learn the basics of the shell and how to navigate the file system.

modules.title: Working with Files and Directories

modules.title: Control Flow

description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to operating systems. You will learn about the fundamental concepts of operating systems, including processes, threads, memory management, and file systems.

modules.title: Introduction to Operating Systems

modules.title: Processes and Threads
modules.lesson: Learn about processes and threads and how they are managed by the operating system.

modules.title: Memory Management
modules.lesson: Learn about different memory management techniques, such as paging and segmentation.

modules.title: File Systems
modules.lesson: Learn about file systems and how they are implemented.

quiz.question: What is the main function of an operating system?
options: To manage the computer's hardware and software resources.
quiz.answer: To manage the computer's hardware and software resources.

quiz.question: What is a process?
What is the purpose of virtual memory?
options: To allow a program to use more memory than is physically available.
To make the computer more secure.
To make the computer more reliable.
quiz.answer: To allow a program to use more memory than is physically available.

title: Computer Networks
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to computer networks. You will learn about the fundamental concepts of computer networks, including the OSI model, TCP/IP, and network protocols.

modules.title: Introduction to Computer Networks
modules.lesson: Learn the basics of computer networks and the OSI model.

modules.title: The Physical Layer
modules.lesson: Learn about the physical layer of the OSI model and different transmission media.

modules.title: The Data Link Layer
modules.lesson: Learn about the data link layer of the OSI model and error detection and correction techniques.

modules.title: The Network Layer
modules.lesson: Learn about the network layer of the OSI model and routing algorithms.

quiz.question: What are the seven layers of the OSI model?
options: Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application
Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, User
Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Application, User
Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Application, Presentation, User
quiz.answer: Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the network layer?
options: To transmit bits over a communication channel.
To provide reliable data transfer between two nodes.
To route packets from a source to a destination.
quiz.answer: To route packets from a source to a destination.

quiz.question: What is the difference between TCP and UDP?
options: TCP is connection-oriented, while UDP is connectionless.
TCP is less reliable than UDP.
TCP is used for video streaming, while UDP is used for file transfer.
quiz.answer: TCP is connection-oriented, while UDP is connectionless.

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified Computer Networks Professional
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

title: Cyber Security Fundamentals
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to cyber security. You will learn about the fundamental concepts of cyber security, including threats, vulnerabilities, and countermeasures.

modules.title: Introduction to Cyber Security
modules.lesson: Learn the basics of cyber security and the CIA triad.

modules.title: Common Cyber Threats
modules.lesson: Learn about common cyber threats, such as malware, phishing, and denial-of-service attacks.

modules.title: Cryptography
modules.lesson: Learn the basics of cryptography and how it is used to secure data.

modules.title: Network Security
modules.lesson: Learn about network security concepts, such as firewalls and intrusion detection systems.

quiz.question: What does CIA stand for in the context of cyber security?
What is phishing?
options: A type of malware that encrypts your files and demands a ransom.
A type of attack that attempts to trick you into revealing sensitive information.
A type of attack that floods a server with traffic, making it unavailable to legitimate users.
A type of attack that exploits a vulnerability in a software program.
quiz.answer: A type of attack that attempts to trick you into revealing sensitive information.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of a firewall?
options: To prevent unauthorized access to your network.
quiz.answer: To prevent unauthorized access to your network.

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified Cyber Security Professional
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

title: Machine Learning with Python
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to machine learning with Python. You will learn about the fundamental concepts of machine learning, including supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and deep learning.

modules.title: Introduction to Machine Learning
modules.lesson: Learn the basics of machine learning and its applications.

modules.title: Supervised Learning
modules.lesson: Learn about supervised learning algorithms, such as linear regression, logistic regression, and support vector machines.

modules.title: Unsupervised Learning
modules.lesson: Learn about unsupervised learning algorithms, such as k-means clustering and principal component analysis.

modules.title: Deep Learning
modules.lesson: Learn the fundamentals of deep learning and how to build neural networks with Python.

modules.title: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
modules.lesson: Learn how to process and analyze text data using NLP techniques.

modules.title: Computer Vision
modules.lesson: Learn how to process and analyze image data using computer vision techniques.

quiz.question: What is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning?
options: Supervised learning uses labeled data, while unsupervised learning uses unlabeled data.
Supervised learning is used for classification, while unsupervised learning is used for regression.
Supervised learning is more accurate than unsupervised learning.
Supervised learning is faster than unsupervised learning.
quiz.answer: Supervised learning uses labeled data, while unsupervised learning uses unlabeled data.

quiz.question: Which of the following is a supervised learning algorithm?
What is a neural network?
options: A data structure that is used to store data in a hierarchical manner.
A machine learning model that is inspired by the human brain.
A type of algorithm that is used for sorting data.
A type of algorithm that is used for searching data.
quiz.answer: A machine learning model that is inspired by the human brain.

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified Machine Learning with Python Expert

title: Deep Learning Basics
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to deep learning. You will learn about the fundamental concepts of deep learning, including neural networks, convolutional neural networks, and recurrent neural networks.

modules.title: Introduction to Deep Learning
modules.lesson: Learn the basics of deep learning and its applications.

modules.title: Neural Networks
modules.lesson: Learn how to build and train neural networks.

modules.title: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
modules.lesson: Learn how to build and train CNNs for image classification.

modules.title: Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs)
modules.lesson: Learn how to build and train RNNs for sequence data.

modules.title: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
modules.lesson: Learn how to build and train GANs to generate new data.

modules.title: Deep Learning Frameworks
modules.lesson: Learn how to use popular deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.

quiz.question: What is a convolutional neural network (CNN)?
options: A type of neural network that is used for processing sequence data.
A type of neural network that is used for processing image data.
A type of neural network that is used for generating new data.
A type of neural network that is used for clustering data.
quiz.answer: A type of neural network that is used for processing image data.

quiz.question: What is a recurrent neural network (RNN)?
options: A type of neural network that is used for processing sequence data.
A type of neural network that is used for processing image data.
A type of neural network that is used for generating new data.
A type of neural network that is used for clustering data.
quiz.answer: A type of neural network that is used for processing sequence data.

quiz.question: What is a generative adversarial network (GAN)?
options: A type of neural network that is used for processing sequence data.
A type of neural network that is used for processing image data.
A type of neural network that is used for generating new data.
A type of neural network that is used for clustering data.
quiz.answer: A type of neural network that is used for generating new data.

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified Deep Learning Expert
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

Machine learning is a subset of AI, which is a subset of deep learning.

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified MongoDB Developer
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

title: REST API Development
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to REST API development. You will learn about the fundamental concepts of REST, including resources, representations, and hypermedia.

modules.title: Introduction to REST
modules.lesson: Learn the basics of REST and the six architectural constraints.

modules.title: Resources and Representations
modules.lesson: Learn how to design and represent resources in a REST API.

modules.title: Hypermedia
modules.lesson: Learn how to use hypermedia to create self-discoverable REST APIs.

quiz.question: What does REST stand for?
What is a resource in a REST API?
options: A piece of data that can be accessed via a URI.
A function that can be called via a URI.
A service that can be accessed via a URI.
A component that can be accessed via a URI.
quiz.answer: A piece of data that can be accessed via a URI.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of hypermedia in a REST API?
options: To make the API more secure.
To make the API more reliable.

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified REST API Developer
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

title: System Design Basics
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to system design. You will learn about the fundamental concepts of system design, including scalability, availability, and performance.

modules.title: Introduction to System Design
modules.lesson: Learn the basics of system design and the system design process.

modules.title: Scalability
modules.lesson: Learn how to design scalable systems that can handle a large number of users.

modules.title: Availability
modules.lesson: Learn how to design highly available systems that are resilient to failures.

modules.title: Performance
modules.lesson: Learn how to design high-performance systems that can handle a large number of requests.

modules.title: Caching
modules.lesson: Learn how to use caching to improve the performance of your systems.

modules.title: Databases
modules.lesson: Learn how to choose the right database for your system.

quiz.question: What is scalability?
options: The ability of a system to handle a large number of users.
The ability of a system to be resilient to failures.
The ability of a system to handle a large number of requests.
The ability of a system to be easy to use.
quiz.answer: The ability of a system to handle a large number of users.

quiz.question: What is availability?
options: The ability of a system to handle a large number of users.
The ability of a system to be resilient to failures.
The ability of a system to handle a large number of requests.
The ability of a system to be easy to use.
quiz.answer: The ability of a system to be resilient to failures.

quiz.question: What is performance?
options: The ability of a system to handle a large number of users.
The ability of a system to be resilient to failures.
The ability of a system to handle a large number of requests.
The ability of a system to be easy to use.
quiz.answer: The ability of a system to handle a large number of requests.

certificateDetails.title: InturnX Certified System Design Expert
certificateDetails.criteria: Complete all lessons and score >= 70% in the quiz.

title: Cloud Deployment with CI/CD

modules.title: Introduction to CI/CD

modules.title: Jenkins

modules.title: Docker

modules.title: Kubernetes

quiz.question: What does CI/CD stand for?
What is Jenkins?
What is Docker?

title: Interview Preparation (Technical)
description: This course will help you prepare for technical interviews. You will learn how to solve common coding problems, how to design systems, and how to answer behavioral questions.

modules.title: Data Structures and Algorithms
modules.lesson: Review common data structures and algorithms and practice solving coding problems.

modules.title: System Design
modules.lesson: Learn how to design scalable and reliable systems.

modules.title: Behavioral Questions
modules.lesson: Learn how to answer common behavioral questions using the STAR method.

modules.title: Company-Specific Preparation
modules.lesson: Learn how to research companies and prepare for company-specific questions.

modules.title: Mock Interviews
modules.lesson: Practice your interviewing skills with mock interviews.

modules.title: Salary Negotiation
modules.lesson: Learn how to negotiate your salary and benefits.

quiz.question: What is the STAR method?
options: A method for answering behavioral questions.
A method for solving coding problems.
quiz.answer: A method for answering behavioral questions.
